comments.body: @seberg Are there any issues with boolean indexing. ISTR you will be making some mods there.
No, they just go through the typical fancy indexing stuff, i.e. get converted to normal fancy indexes first. The issues are that purely non-fancy indices will not work.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +973,977 @@        assert_equal(a, np.array([0, 1, 4414, 46, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9]))

        # Test boolean indexing and boolean ufuncs
        a = np.arange(10)
        index = a % 2 == 0
